definitions: large landmass bordered by Asia, Arctic Ocean, Atlantic Ocean and Mediterranean Sea
political and economic union of European nations sharing common institutions and policies
examples: Europe extends from Portugal in the west to Russia's Ural Mountains
Medieval Europe witnessed the rise of powerful kingdoms and empires
Europe adopted strict environmental regulations for all member states
Economic integration in Europe has created the world's largest single market

definitions: individual who is native to or citizen of any European country
relating to or characteristic of Europe, its peoples, cultures, or languages
examples: Many Europeans speak multiple languages fluently from childhood
The European settled in New York after completing her doctorate
European architecture features diverse styles from Gothic to Baroque
European cuisine varies dramatically from Mediterranean to Scandinavian regions

definitions: Christian preacher who travels to spread the gospel and convert others to Christianity
person who enthusiastically promotes or advocates for a particular cause, technology, or idea
examples: The evangelist traveled through rural communities conducting revival meetings
Billy Graham became the most famous evangelist of the twentieth century
She's a technology evangelist who promotes digital literacy in schools
The company hired a product evangelist to build developer community enthusiasm

definitions: day or period immediately before an important event or holiday
first woman in biblical creation story, wife of Adam in Garden of Eden
archaic or poetic term for evening or the period before nightfall
examples: New Year's Eve celebrations began at sunset around the world
On the eve of battle, soldiers wrote letters to their families
Eve ate the forbidden fruit from the Tree of Knowledge
The painting depicts Eve in the Garden of Eden with Adam
The stars appeared in the eve as darkness slowly descended
They met in the garden every eve to share their stories

definitions: Earth's highest mountain above sea level, located in the Himalayas between Nepal and Tibet
metaphorical reference to the ultimate challenge or highest achievement in any field
examples: Mount Everest rises to 29,032 feet above sea level
Climbing Everest requires months of preparation and acclimatization
Winning the Nobel Prize was the Everest of her scientific career
For him, mastering Bach's fugues was his musical Everest

definitions: adult female sheep typically kept for breeding and wool production
examples: The ewe protected her lambs from the approaching storm
Each ewe in the flock can produce twins during lambing season

definitions: mythical sword of King Arthur in Arthurian legend, symbolizing rightful sovereignty of Britain
examples: Arthur pulled Excalibur from the stone to prove his kingship
According to legend, Excalibur was returned to the Lady of the Lake

definitions: formal title of address for high-ranking officials such as governors, ambassadors, or bishops
state of being excellent or having outstanding quality in highest degree
examples: His Excellency the Ambassador will address the United Nations tomorrow
Your Excellency, the delegation from Japan has arrived for the meeting
The excellency of her performance earned a standing ovation
The wine's excellency was evident in its complex flavor profile

definitions: person who travels to unfamiliar places to discover new information or territories
software application for browsing and navigating computer files or internet content
examples: The explorer mapped uncharted regions of the Amazon rainforest
Famous explorers like Columbus changed the course of human history
Internet Explorer was Microsoft's web browser for many years
Use File Explorer to navigate through your computer's directory structure

definitions: Hebrew prophet and priest who authored the Book of Ezekiel in the Old Testament
masculine given name of Hebrew origin meaning God strengthens
examples: Ezekiel prophesied during the Babylonian exile of the Jewish people
The Book of Ezekiel contains vivid visions and symbolic prophecies
Ezekiel joined the company as the new financial director last month
My grandfather Ezekiel immigrated from Eastern Europe in 1920

definitions: Jewish scribe and priest who led the return from Babylonian exile and reformed Jewish law
masculine given name of Hebrew origin meaning help or helper
examples: Ezra led the second group of exiles back to Jerusalem
The Book of Ezra describes the rebuilding of the Temple
Ezra completed his medical degree at Johns Hopkins University
The poet Ezra Pound influenced modern American literature significantly

definitions: Federal Aviation Administration, the United States government agency regulating civil aviation and air traffic control
examples: The FAA grounded all flights following the security breach
Pilots must comply with FAA regulations for commercial operations

definitions: Frequently Asked Questions, a list of common questions and answers about a particular topic
examples: Check the FAQ section before contacting customer support
The website's FAQ page addresses most installation issues

definitions: Federal Bureau of Investigation, the principal federal law enforcement and domestic intelligence agency of the United States
examples: The FBI investigated the interstate fraud case for two years
FBI agents arrested the suspects after months of surveillance

definitions: Federal Communications Commission, the United States agency regulating interstate and international communications by radio, television, wire, satellite, and cable
examples: The FCC approved the merger between the two telecommunications companies
Broadcasting stations must obtain licenses from the FCC to operate

definitions: Food and Drug Administration, the United States agency responsible for protecting public health through regulation of food, drugs, medical devices, and cosmetics
examples: The FDA approved the new cancer treatment after clinical trials
All pharmaceutical companies must submit their products for FDA review

definitions: Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, the United States agency that insures deposits in banks and savings associations against bank failures
examples: The FDIC insures individual bank deposits up to $250,000
When the bank failed, FDIC insurance protected customer deposits

definitions: Franklin Delano Roosevelt, the 32nd President of the United States who served from 1933 to 1945
examples: FDR implemented the New Deal during the Great Depression
FDR was the only president elected to four consecutive terms

definitions: Federal Emergency Management Agency, the United States agency coordinating government response to natural and man-made disasters
examples: FEMA deployed resources immediately after the hurricane struck
The governor requested FEMA assistance for flood recovery efforts

definitions: Federal Housing Administration, the United States agency providing mortgage insurance on loans made by approved lenders
examples: First-time buyers often qualify for FHA loans with lower down payments
The FHA insured over one million mortgages last year

definitions: First In First Out, an inventory valuation method where items purchased or produced first are sold or used first
examples: The warehouse uses FIFO to ensure older products ship before newer ones
FIFO accounting methods can affect a company's reported profits significantly

definitions: deciduous tree or shrub producing sweet, soft fruit with many small seeds
sweet pear-shaped fruit eaten fresh or dried, containing numerous small seeds
something of little or no value or importance in informal usage
examples: The fig tree in their garden produces fruit twice each year
Mediterranean climates are ideal for growing fig trees
Fresh figs paired with cheese make an elegant appetizer
Dried figs are popular ingredients in holiday baking
I don't give a fig about what the critics say
His opinion isn't worth a fig in this matter

definitions: quick movement rotating something over to show its opposite side
sudden reversal of position, opinion, or situation
mixed drink containing beaten egg, sugar, and alcohol, typically served warm
examples: The pancake needs one more flip before it's ready
With a flip of the switch, the room filled with light
His flip from supporting to opposing the proposal surprised everyone
The market experienced a dramatic flip from bearish to bullish
The bartender prepared a traditional brandy flip for the customer
Holiday flips often include nutmeg and cinnamon spices

definitions: Federal Trade Commission, the United States agency protecting consumers and promoting competition through antitrust enforcement
examples: The FTC filed an antitrust lawsuit against the tech giant
Consumer complaints to the FTC increased during the holiday shopping season

definitions: File Transfer Protocol, a standard network protocol used for transferring files between computers over a TCP/IP network
examples: Use FTP to upload website files to the server
The FTP connection requires a username and password for security

definitions: temperature scale where water freezes at 32 degrees and boils at 212 degrees under standard atmospheric pressure
examples: The thermometer showed 98.6 degrees Fahrenheit, normal body temperature
Convert Celsius to Fahrenheit by multiplying by 1.8 and adding 32

definitions: season between summer and winter when temperatures cool and leaves change color
act or instance of dropping or descending under the force of gravity
decline in power, status, or prosperity of a person, institution, or civilization
examples: Fall brings colorful foliage to New England every October
University classes resume in the fall after summer break
The fall from the ladder resulted in a broken ankle
Heavy rainfall caused a fall of rocks from the cliff
The fall of the Roman Empire occurred over several centuries
His fall from grace shocked the entire political establishment

definitions: comic character in Shakespeare's plays, a fat, witty, and cowardly knight appearing in Henry IV and The Merry Wives of Windsor
examples: Falstaff provides comic relief in Shakespeare's history plays
The actor's portrayal of Falstaff earned critical acclaim

definitions: long, sharp, pointed tooth of a carnivorous animal used for seizing prey
hollow or grooved tooth through which venomous snakes inject poison into victims
examples: The wolf bared its fangs as a warning to stay away
Tiger fangs can grow up to three inches long
The cobra's fangs delivered venom into the mouse instantly
Rattlesnake fangs fold back when the mouth is closed

definitions: Michael Faraday, British scientist who contributed to the study of electromagnetism and electrochemistry
unit of electrical charge equal to the charge of one mole of electrons
examples: Faraday discovered the principles of electromagnetic induction in 1831
The Faraday cage is named after this pioneering scientist
One faraday equals approximately 96,485 coulombs of electric charge
Calculate the faradays needed for this electrochemical reaction

definitions: person who owns or manages a farm, growing crops or raising animals for food production
examples: The farmer harvested wheat from his hundred-acre field
Local farmers sell fresh produce at the weekend market

definitions: modern Persian language spoken primarily in Iran, Afghanistan, and Tajikistan, written in Arabic script
examples: She studied Farsi to communicate with her Iranian colleagues
Farsi poetry has a rich tradition dating back centuries

definitions: male parent of a child through biological relationship or legal adoption
title for a priest, especially in Catholic, Orthodox, or Anglican churches
person who creates, originates, or founds something important
examples: His father taught him to ride a bicycle when he was six
The father of three works as an engineer downtown
Father Michael will conduct the Sunday morning service
She went to Father O'Brien for spiritual guidance
George Washington is called the father of his country
Einstein is considered the father of modern physics

definitions: state or role of being a father, including the responsibilities and experiences of raising children
examples: Fatherhood changed his perspective on work-life balance completely
The challenges of fatherhood require patience and dedication

definitions: legendary German scholar who makes a pact with the devil, featured in works by Marlowe and Goethe
examples: Goethe's Faust remains one of German literature's greatest achievements
The Faust legend warns against selling one's soul for knowledge

definitions: abbreviated form of February, the second month of the year
examples: The conference is scheduled for Feb 15th this year
Sales reports for Feb showed significant improvement

definitions: second month of the year in the Gregorian calendar, typically having 28 days or 29 in leap years
examples: February is the shortest month of the calendar year
Valentine's Day falls on February 14th each year

definitions: Federal Reserve System, the central banking system of the United States
past tense of feed, having given food to or having eaten
examples: The Fed raised interest rates to combat inflation
Markets reacted strongly to the Fed's policy announcement
She fed the baby before putting him to sleep
The data fed into the system updated automatically

definitions: relating to a system of government where power is divided between central and regional authorities
pertaining to the national government as opposed to state or local governments
examples: The federal system allows states to maintain their own laws
Federal courts have jurisdiction over constitutional matters
Federal agencies oversee interstate commerce regulations
She works for the federal government in Washington

definitions: supporter of federal system of government or strong central government
member of the Federalist Party in early United States history
examples: The federalist argued for stronger national defense capabilities
Modern federalists support European Union integration
Alexander Hamilton led the Federalist Party in the 1790s
The Federalist Papers defended the new Constitution

definitions: powerful synthetic opioid pain medication that is 50 to 100 times more potent than morphine
examples: Doctors prescribe fentanyl patches for severe chronic pain management
The fentanyl crisis has become a major public health emergency

definitions: Pierre de Fermat, French mathematician who made contributions to number theory, probability, and calculus
examples: Fermat's Last Theorem remained unproven for over 350 years
The Fermat point minimizes the sum of distances to triangle vertices

definitions: Enrico Fermi, Italian-American physicist who created the first nuclear reactor and contributed to quantum theory
unit of length equal to one femtometer, used in nuclear physics
examples: Fermi received the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1938
The Fermi paradox questions why we haven't detected alien civilizations
Nuclear radii are measured in fermis, typically 1-10 fermis
The proton has a radius of approximately 0.84 fermis

definitions: Richard Feynman, American theoretical physicist known for work in quantum mechanics and particle physics
examples: Feynman diagrams revolutionized how physicists calculate particle interactions
The Feynman Lectures on Physics remain essential reading for students

definitions: cylindrical felt hat with a flat top and tassel, traditionally worn in Middle Eastern and North African countries
historic city in Morocco known for its medieval architecture and traditional crafts
examples: The red fez was part of the Ottoman Empire's official dress
He wore a traditional fez to the cultural celebration
Fez contains one of the world's oldest universities
The medina of Fez is a UNESCO World Heritage site

definitions: island country in the South Pacific Ocean comprising more than 300 islands
examples: Fiji attracts tourists with its pristine beaches and coral reefs
The Republic of Fiji gained independence from Britain in 1970

definitions: person who is a native or citizen of Fiji
Austronesian language spoken by indigenous people of Fiji
examples: The Fijian rugby team is known for their passionate playing style
Many Fijians work in the tourism and hospitality industry
She learned Fijian to better communicate with local communities
Fijian has several dialects across the different islands

definitions: person who organizes and finances concerts, theatrical productions, or other entertainment events
examples: The impresario brought world-class opera performances to the city
A successful impresario must balance artistic vision with financial reality

definitions: idea, feeling, or opinion formed about something or someone based on limited information
mark or indentation made by pressing something onto a surface
entertainment act where someone imitates another person's voice, mannerisms, or behavior
examples: First impressions often influence long-term professional relationships
The novel left a lasting impression on readers worldwide
The fossil impression in the rock was millions of years old
Dental impressions help create accurate crowns and bridges
His impression of the president had the audience laughing
She does brilliant impressions of famous movie characters

definitions: artist associated with Impressionism, the 19th-century art movement emphasizing light and color
entertainer who specializes in imitating voices and mannerisms of famous people
examples: Monet was a leading impressionist painter of the nineteenth century
Impressionist paintings often depicted outdoor scenes with visible brushstrokes
The impressionist performed spot-on imitations of political figures
Television impressionists often appear on comedy sketch shows
